message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about thermoregulation in animals. When some animals get hot, they perspire in order to lower their body temperature. Option (A) is incorrect because animals do not spend money to cool down. Option (B) is incorrect because raising blood temperature would only make the animals hotter. Option (C) is incorrect because not all animals have the ability to fly, and flying away does not directly lower body temperature.

Perspiration helps cool the body through the evaporation of sweat. Option (A) is incorrect because animals do not spend money to lower their body temperature. Option (B) is incorrect because raising blood temperature would actually increase body temperature. Option (C) is incorrect because not all animals have the ability to fly away to cool down, and flying does not directly lower body temperature.
